name: frictional
content:
frictional adjective
(FORCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
connected with friction (= the force that makes it difficult for an object to move along or through something): Any two surfaces rubbing together produce frictional heat. There must be a frictional force pulling the bottom of the ladder in.
More examplesFewer examplesBicycle technology has low frictional losses.Mechanical devices support rotating shafts with a minimal amount of frictional resistance.the frictional drag of the Earth's atmosphere

frictional adjective
(DISAGREEMENT)
involving disagreement and unfriendliness caused by people having different opinions: The band had a frictional relationship with their record company. See
friction
More examplesFewer examplesHe is still in the difficult, frictional, vulnerable position of striving to be the best.This system of agreeing medical costs between insurer and doctor is frictional and inefficient.We might see a fraught and frictional type of transaction between public and government becoming more common.
